hook.text: The same drug at the same dose can cure one patient and kill another. The difference is in their DNA.

buildup.text: Pharmacogenomics studies how genetic variations affect individual responses to medications.

discovery.text: Genes control the enzymes that metabolize drugs. Fast metabolizers may need higher doses; slow ones risk toxicity.

twist.text: Codeine is converted to morphine by one enzyme. People without that enzyme get no pain relief at all.

climax.text: Genetic testing before prescribing could personalize drug choice and doseâ€”reducing side effects dramatically.

punchline.text: Your genes decide how drugs work in your body.

quiz.question: Why does codeine not work for some people?
options: They lack the enzyme that converts codeine into its active form
Codeine only works when combined with other painkillers
Their pain receptors are resistant to all opioid drugs
